alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Franklin; Fulton; Huntingdon; Juniata; Perry (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 09 at 1:24AM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Cumberland, Franklin, Fulton, Huntingdon, Juniata and Perry. * WHEN...Until 330 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 122 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall of up to 1 inch is expected over portions of this area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Waterfall, Rockhill Furnace, Wells Tannery, Fort Littleton, Valley-Hi, Willow Hill, Doylesburg, Fannettsburg, Big Spring State Park, Roxbury, Perulack, Sideling Hill Rest Area, Saluvia, Colonel Denning State Park, Three Springs, Orbisonia, Saltillo, Blain, Shirleysburg and Cassville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

area.areaDesc: Cumberland; Franklin; Fulton; Huntingdon; Juniata; Perry
